dialogue.text: 「Bad luck, mate, but you’ll pass next time — we can take it together.」
"Yeah, I s'pose," Ron grumbled. "But half an eyebrow! Like that matters!"
「I know, it does seem really harsh. . . .」
「Yeah, it's like they're trying to make us suffer. But hey, we've faced worse, right? We'll get through it together, Hermione.」
「What are you talking about? said Hermione, laughing. You’ve never taken any!」
"Yeah, but I thought I had, didn't I? Same difference really..."
「Leave him alone, he didn’t want all that!」
"Yeah, leave him alone! Can't you see he's had enough? Give the guy some space, will ya?"
「Oh no, really?」
"Well, that's lucky. But honestly, Hermione, can't you see that Harry's been through enough already? No need to rub it in."

「I don’t know, sir. I don’t know, sir. I think Hermione does, though, why don’t you try her? I don’t know. I think Hermione does, though, why don’t you try her? I don’t know. I think Hermione does, though, why don’t you try her?」

"Oi, Harry! No need to keep repeating yourself like a broken record. Hermione might have the answers, but she's not here right now. So, why don't we put our heads together and try to figure it out ourselves? We've faced worse challenges before, haven't we?"
「why didn’t you tell him not to add the quills? Thought he’d make you look good if he got it wrong, did you? That’s another point you’ve lost for Gryffindor.」
「Don't push it, I've heard Snape can turn very nasty.」
「Shoes off, if you please, Master Harry, and hands washed before dinner.」
"Oh, come on, Kreacher! Can't you give us a break for once? We're in a hurry here!"

「Hermione think "‘Severus Snape, long-standing Potions master at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, was today appointed headmaster in the most important of several staffing changes at the ancient school. Following the resignation of the previous Muggle Studies teacher, Alecto Carrow will take over the post while her brother, Amycus, fills the position of Defense Against the Dark Arts professor. ‘I welcome the opportunity to uphold our finest Wizarding traditions and values —’ Like committing murder and cutting off people’s ears, I suppose! Snape, headmaster! Snape in Dumbledore’s study — Merlin’s pants!” she shrieked, making both Harry and Ron jump. She leapt up from the table and hurtled from the room, shouting as she went, “I’ll be back in a minute!”"」
「‘Merlin’s pants’? She must be upset.」
「Filch action」

「Oh, there you are, Filch. Just talking about you. We were just saying how much we'll miss Mrs. Norris. Such a lovely cat, really. So sorry to hear about what happened. But don't worry, they'll catch the culprit soon enough. And hey, maybe they'll even Petrify you before they kick you out. Just kidding, Filch. Just kidding.」

「As she spoke, they turned a corner and found themselves at the end of the very corridor where the attack had happened. They stopped and looked. The scene was just as it had been that night, except that there was no stiff cat hanging from the torch bracket, and an empty chair stood against the wall bearing the message “The Chamber of Secrets Has Been Opened.”」
「Bloody hell, not again! The Chamber of Secrets has been opened? This can't be good.」
「“No,” said Harry, “have you, Ron? Ron?”」

「Huh? Oh, sorry mate, got lost in my thoughts. No, I haven't seen him either. But don't worry, he's probably just busy with some top-secret Order of the Phoenix stuff. You know how Dumbledore operates.」
「Red card! In soccer you get shown the red card and you’re out of the game!」
"Oh, come on, Dean! This isn't soccer, mate. We're talking about real life here, not some game on a pitch. No need for red cards or anything like that."
「You’d better get along to the hospital wing, Weasley, you’re bleeding.」
「Oh, it's just a scratch, Professor. I'll be fine. No need to worry about me.」
「You will eat in here and then go straight up to your dormitory. I must also return to the feast.」
「I thought we’d had it.」
「We’ll have to watch our step from now on, though. Wish we could’ve gone up to the feast...」
「She didn’t want us showing off. Doesn’t want people to think it’s clever, arriving by flying car.」
「You’re not telling me you did fly here?」
「Skip the lecture, and tell us the new password.」
「We’ll have to watch our step from now on, though. Wish we could’ve gone up to the feast. . . .」
「Yeah, it would've been nice to celebrate with everyone. But hey, at least we have each other, right? And who needs a fancy feast when we can have our own little adventure out here?」
「You’re not telling me you did fly here?」
「No, Hermione, I fell off my broomstick and landed here.」

「Harry think "The Hogwarts grounds never looked more inviting than when Harry had to stay indoors. For the next few days he spent all of his free time either in the library with Hermione and Ron, looking up hexes, or else in empty classrooms, which they sneaked into to practice. Harry was concentrating on the Stunning Spell, which he had never used before. The trouble was that practicing it involved certain sacrifices on Ron’s and Hermione’s part."」

"Well, mate, Harry here has been practicing the Stunning Spell, and let me tell you, it's been quite eventful. You see, the spell requires a target to practice on, and unfortunately, Ron and Hermione have been the ones sacrificing themselves for the cause. They've been getting Stunned left and right, and let me tell you, it's not the most pleasant experience. But hey, we're all in this together, right? Gotta support Harry in his training for the third task. Though I must admit, I'm aching all over from being Stunned so many times. Hermione keeps telling me to aim better, but it's not as easy as it sounds, you know?"
「Well, you keep missing the cushions, don’t you! Just try and fall backward!」

「Oi, Hermione, no need to get all worked up! Falling backward is harder than it looks, you know. Besides, it's not like we're aiming for the cushions on purpose. It's just a bit of practice, that's all.」

「It was true that Harry wasn’t going back to Privet Drive for Christmas. Professor McGonagall had come around the week before, making a list of students who would be staying for the holidays, and Harry had signed up at once. He didn’t feel sorry for himself at all; this would probably be the best Christmas he’d ever had. Ron and his brothers were staying, too, because Mr. and Mrs. Weasley were going to Romania to visit Charlie.」

"Well, Harry, looks like we're in for a jolly holiday at Hogwarts, just the two of us and the Slytherins. Can't say I'm too thrilled about it, but hey, at least we won't have to deal with Malfoy's snide remarks for a while. And who needs a fancy Christmas at home when we've got the magical wonders of Hogwarts, right?"

「“Would you mind moving out of the way? Are you trying to earn some extra money, Weasley? Hoping to be gamekeeper yourself when you leave Hogwarts, I suppose — that hut of Hagrid’s must seem like a palace compared to what your family’s used to.”」

"Oh, look who's here, the great Malfoy. Always trying to belittle others to make yourself feel superior, aren't you? Well, newsflash, Malfoy, money and fancy houses don't make you a better person. It's about character and loyalty, something you clearly lack. So why don't you crawl back to your little pure-blood bubble and leave us alone?"
「Malfoy action」
"Don't worry, Hermione. Malfoy won't dare to mess with you. We've got your back."
「So after E, it’s A for ‘Acceptable,’ and that’s the last pass grade, isn’t it?」

"Well, Hermione, you've got it all figured out, haven't you? Yes, A is the last pass grade, but let's not get ahead of ourselves. We've still got a lot of studying to do before we start worrying about grades. Besides, who needs top marks when you've got a friend like me to keep you entertained?"
「Good luck, Harry Potter. The planets have been read wrongly before now, even by centaurs. I hope this is one of those times.」

"Thanks, mate. I appreciate the vote of confidence. But you know what they say, 'It's not all about the planets and prophecies, it's about what we make of our own choices.' So, let's give it our best shot and see what happens, yeah?"
「Snape wants the Stone for Voldemort . . . and Voldemort’s waiting in the forest . . . and all this time we thought Snape just wanted to get rich. . . .」
「Stop saying the name!」
「Would you say you were close to Dumbledore, Ronald?」
「Me? Not really... It was always Harry who...」

「If you were not very close to Dumbledore, how do you account for the fact that he remembered you in his will? He made exceptionally few personal bequests. The vast majority of his possessions - his private library, his magical instruments, and other personal effects - were left to Hogwarts. Why do you think you were singled out?I... dunno. I... when I say we weren't close... I mean, I think he liked me...」
「That is a valuable object. It may even be unique. Certainly it is of Dumbledore's own design. Why would he have left you an item so rare?」
「Dumbledore must have taught thousands of students. Yet the only ones he remembered in his will are you three. Why is that? To what use did he think you would put his Deluminator, Mr. Weasley?」

「If you were not very close to Dumbledore, how do you account for the fact that he remembered you in his will? He made exceptionally few personal bequests. The vast majority of his possessions — his private library, his magical instruments, and other personal effects — were left to Hogwarts. Why do you think you were singled out?」

Well, you see, Scrimgeour, Dumbledore must have seen something in me, even if I didn't see it in myself. Maybe he saw potential or loyalty, who knows? But I reckon he believed in me, and that's why he left me something. It's a great honor, really, even if I can't fully understand why he chose me.
「That is a valuable object. It may even be unique. Certainly it is of Dumbledore’s own design. Why would he have left you an item so rare?」

「Well, I reckon Dumbledore saw something in me, something worth trusting. Maybe he knew I could use a little extra help in tough times. And as for the Deluminator, maybe he thought I could use a bit of light in the darkness, you know? Dumbledore was always one for symbolism and hidden meanings. I may not have been the brightest or the most talented, but I guess he believed in me in his own way.」
「You’re not setting a great example!」
Well, mate, I reckon I'm just being myself. Can't always be the perfect role model, can I? But hey, at least I bring some humor to the table, right?

「Yeah . . . well, I saw Malfoy sneaking off with a couple of girls who didn’t look like they wanted to be with him, and that’s the second time he’s made sure he isn’t down on the Quidditch pitch with the rest of the school; he skipped the last match too, remember? Wish I’d followed him now, the match was such a fiasco. . . .」
"You couldn't have missed a Quidditch match just to follow Malfoy, you're the Captain!"
「I want to catch him at it! I mean, where’s he going when he disappears off the map?」
「Well, we can't just sit around and wait for him to slip up, can we? We need to be proactive and find out what he's up to. Maybe we can follow him discreetly and see where he goes.」

「Malfoy’s dad’s frightened the Committee into it, You know what he’s like. They’re a bunch of doddery old fools, and they were scared. There’ll be an appeal, though, there always is. Only I can’t see any hope. . . . .Nothing will have changed.」
「Yeah, it will, You won’t have to do all the work alone this time, Hermione. I’ll help.」
「Ron, I’m really, really sorry about Scabbers . . . . ,」
"Thanks, Hermione. It's alright, really. Scabbers had a good run, I suppose. And hey, maybe it's time for a change. Who needs a rat when I can finally get an owl, right?"
「Don’t you dare call Hagrid pathetic, you foul — you evil —」
"Hermione, calm down! We don't need to stoop to Malfoy's level. Let's focus on supporting Hagrid and making sure he knows we're there for him."
「Harry think "“Think of a dream, quick,” he told Ron, “in case the old toad comes our way.”"」

「Oh, right. Well, I dreamed that I was playing Quidditch the other night. I was flying high on my broomstick, chasing after the Snitch, and the crowd was cheering like mad. It felt amazing, you know? Like I was on top of the world. But then, suddenly, my broomstick started to malfunction, and I couldn't control it anymore. I was spiraling out of control, heading straight for the ground. It was terrifying, mate. I woke up in a cold sweat, heart pounding.」
「Harry think "Speechless, carried the Firebolt back upstairs toward Gryffindor Tower."」

"Well, mate, I reckon it's worth a try. Firebolt's a top-quality broom, built to withstand a lot. Let's hope it's still in flying condition. We'll give it a thorough check and see if it's ready to take to the skies again."
「Yeah . . . anything . . . You know what — we should make up with Hermione. . . . She was only trying to help. . . .」
「Yeah, you're right. We shouldn't hold a grudge. She's our friend after all. Let's go find her and apologize.」
「A likely tale! Good even, my fine young yeomen! Come clap this loon in irons. He is trying to force entry to the chambers within!」
Oh, shut up. I’ve lost the passwords! I made him tell me what passwords he was going to use this week, because he keeps changing them, and now I don’t know what I’ve done with them!
「Dobby is going to buy a sweater next, Harry Potter!」
「Tell you what, Dobby, I’ll give you the one my mum knits me this Christmas, I always get one from her. You don’t mind maroon, do you?」
「We might have to shrink it a bit to fit you, but it’ll go well with your tea cozy.」
「Dobby Dobby is delighted.」

"Well, I reckon he's got a lot on his plate, being the Minister and all. But I've heard some interesting things about him. Some say he's a bit too concerned with his own image and doesn't always make the best decisions. But hey, who am I to judge? I'm just a Weasley, after all."
「’Course you can.」
「Yeah, you can do it, Hagrid!」
「Oh she’ll cheer up, Once the shock’s worn off, and she’s got used to Hogwarts, she’ll see how much better off she is without that Crouch man.」
「Yeah, I reckon you're right. She's better off without him.」

「Malfoy think "I’d be careful if I were you, Potter. Unless you’re a bit politer you’ll go the same way as your parents. They didn’t know what was good for them, either. You hang around with riffraff like the Weasleys and that Hagrid, and it’ll rub off on you."」
「Say that again.」
「Oh, you’re going to fight us, are you?」
「Unless you get out now.」
「What has been going on?」

「I’ve heard of his family, They were some of the first to come back to our side after You-Know-Who disappeared. Said they’d been bewitched. My dad doesn’t believe it. He says Malfoy’s father didn’t need an excuse to go over to the Dark Side.Scabbers has been fighting, not us. Would you mind leaving while we change?」
「Ron think "I think he’s been knocked out. No — I don’t believe it — he’s gone back to sleep."」
"Typical. Can't even stay awake for a proper conversation. Well, let him sleep. We've got more important things to worry about."
「“Oooh there’s a tragedy,” Hermione snapped as Fleur went out into the entrance hall. “She really thinks a lot of herself, that one, doesn’t she?”」

"Well, Hermione, everyone's entitled to their own opinion, I suppose. But let's not waste our time worrying about what Fleur thinks of herself. We've got more important things to focus on, like surviving this Triwizard Tournament, right?"
「“Twitchy little ferret, aren’t you, Malfoy?” said Hermione scathingly, and she, Harry, and Ron went up the marble staircase laughing heartily.」
"That's the spirit, Hermione! Give Malfoy a taste of his own medicine. He deserves it, the slimy git."

「Well, if you two are going to chicken out, fine, I don’t want to break rules, you know. I think threatening Muggle-borns is far worse than brewing up a difficult potion. But if you don’t want to find out if it’s Malfoy, I’ll go straight to Madam Pince now and hand the book back in —」
「I never thought I’d see the day when you’d be persuading us to break rules. All right, we’ll do it. But not toenails, okay?」

「How long will it take to make, anyway? Well, since the fluxweed has got to be picked at the full moon and the lacewings have got to be stewed for twenty-one days . . . I’d say it’d be ready in about a month, if we can get all the ingredients.」
「A month? Malfoy could have attacked half the Muggle-borns in the school by then! But it’s the best plan we’ve got, so full steam ahead, I say.」
「Let’s sit down somewhere, Look, this will do, in here!」
"You know, Hermione, I reckon you've got a point. It's always better to be safe than sorry. Let's get those protective enchantments up and running, shall we? Can't be too careful these days."
「Ron, we can’t!」
"Why not? We've got to do something, Hermione! Sitting around here won't help anyone. We need to stand up and fight!"
「I say we find a quiet place to Disapparate and head for the countryside. Once we’re there, we could send a message to the Order.」
"Can you do that talking Patronus thing, then?"
「“That does look good,” said the ghost in the ruff sadly, watching Harry cut up his steak.」
"Oh, sorry about that. You know, Nearly Headless Nick here is always hungry, being a ghost and all. But hey, at least you can enjoy your meal without any interruptions from him!"

「Harry think "wished he could forget what he’d seen in the mirror as easily, but he couldn’t. He started having nightmares. Over and over again he dreamed about his parents disappearing in a flash of green light, while a high voice cackled with laughter."」

"Blimey, Harry, those nightmares sound awful. I can't even imagine what it must be like to see your parents like that. But you know, you're not alone in this. We're here for you, mate. If you ever need to talk or anything, just let us know. We'll always be by your side, no matter what."
「Congratulations!」
"Blimey, thanks! I reckon it's about time we got some good news, eh? But hey, don't get too excited, it's just a little victory. We've still got a long way to go."
「Bought it from Dung ’bout a year ago. Albus told me what it was. Been trying to keep an eye out for you.」
"The silver doe! Was that you too?"
「What are you talking about? Someone sent a doe Patronus to us!」
"Wait, what? Someone sent a doe Patronus? That's... that's exactly what Harry saw in the forest! It led him to the sword of Gryffindor! But who could have sent it? And why?"
「You know how many subjects I’m taking. Couldn’t hold these for me, could you?」
"But —" *pauses and looks at the stack of books* "Alright, fine. I'll hold them for you. Just don't expect me to do your homework too."
「I hope there’s something good for lunch, I’m starving.」
"Well, I reckon we'll have some decent food today. Maybe some roast chicken or treacle tart. I'm starving too, Hermione. Can't wait to fill my belly!"
「An’ someone’ll need ter feed Fang while I’m away.」

Well, Hagrid, I reckon I can take care of Fang for you. No worries there. I've had plenty of experience with him, haven't I? Just make sure you bring back some of those rock cakes you're so famous for. Can't let us go hungry while you're gone, can you?
「“Lupin? Listen, if he had this much gold, he’d be able to buy himself some new robes.”」
「Yeah, but he likes you, And he was away when your Nimbus got smashed, and he might’ve heard about it and decided to visit Diagon Alley and get this for you —」
「“What d’you mean, he was away? He was ill when I was playing in that match.”」
"Well, he wasn't in the hospital wing, I was there, cleaning out the bedpans on that detention from Snape, remember?"
「To our newcomers, welcome! To our old hands — welcome back! There is a time for speech making, but this is not it. Tuck in!」

"Tuck in, indeed! Can't say I'm not hungry after all the excitement today. But honestly, could the first day back at Hogwarts be any more eventful? Dragons, escaped prisoners, and now a feast. It's like we never left!"
「Yes, I have heard the hat give several warnings before, always at times when it detects periods of great danger for the school. And always, of course, its advice is the same」
"How can it know if the school's in danger if it's just a hat? I mean, it's not like it has eyes or ears, right? Maybe it's just guessing or something."

「Peaceful cooperation, that’s the key. We ghosts, though we belong to separate Houses, maintain links of friendship. In spite of the competitiveness between Gryffindor and Slytherin, I would never dream of seeking an argument with the Bloody Baron.」
「Yeah, well, you’re dead, aren’t you?」
「Listen . . . sounds like something big. . . .」
「Oh, no, oh, no, oh —」
「Shut up. It’ll hear you.」
「Hear me? It’s already heard Fang!」
「D’you think it’s gone?Come on!」
「It’s our car!」
「Shut up. It’ll hear you.」
「Hear me? It’s already heard Fang!」
「Come on!」
「Yeah, yeah, keep your hair on!」
「Ah, yes. That silly girl acted most unwisely there —」
"Shut up about my sister, Phineas Nigellus! You've got no right to talk about her like that!"
「Get Fang!」
「Right, let's go. And remember, stick together and stay quiet.」
「That Hagrid never opened the Chamber of Secrets. He was innocent.」
「What was the point of sending us in there? What have we found out, I’d like to know?」
「Percy sat down and grabbed a mug from the center of the table」
「Oi, Percy! We're in the middle of explaining everything to Professor McGonagall here. Can't you wait a moment?」
「Oh — that — that’s nothing to do with the Chamber of Secrets」
"What were you doing, Percy? Go on, tell us, we won’t laugh."
「OH NOT AGAIN!」
"Oh, Mum, calm down! It's just a little mishap, no need to get your knickers in a twist."
「Ron think "After letting in half a dozen goals, most of them scored by Ginny, his technique became wilder and wilder, until he finally punched an oncoming Demelza Robins in the mouth."」
「Oi! It was an accident, I’m sorry, Demelza, really sorry! I just... got a bit carried away, you know?」
「Hagrid action」
「once Hagrid’s found out what they eat, I expect they’ll be six feet long」
「Well, that won’t matter if they turn out to cure seasickness or something, will it?」
「Muggles have garden gnomes, too, you know,」

Yeah, I’ve seen those things they think are gnomes, like fat little Santa Clauses with fishing rods. But let me tell you, mate, this is a gnome. They're not as cute and harmless as those Muggle imitations. These little pests wreak havoc in our garden, and my dad thinks they're funny. Can you believe it?
「 Soon, the crowd of gnomes in the field started walking away in a straggling line, their little shoulders hunched.」
"They'll be back. They love it here... Dad's too soft with them; he thinks they're funny."
「But I think Durmstrang must be somewhere in the far north, Somewhere very cold, because they’ve got fur capes as part of their uniforms.」
"Ah, think of the possibilities! It would've been so easy to push Malfoy off a glacier and make it look like an accident... Shame his mother likes him..."
「His lovely shiny new prefect’s badge.」
「His . . . but . . . Ron, you’re not . . . ?I don’t believe it! I don’t believe it! Oh, Ron, how wonderful! A prefect! That’s everyone in the family!」
「Well, what will it be? We gave Percy an owl, but you’ve already got one, of course.」
「W-what do you mean?」
「Or a new cauldron, Charlie’s old one’s rusting through, or a new rat, you always liked Scabbers —」
「Mum, can I have a new broom?」
「We could curtsy, if you like,」
「Oh, shut up,」
「Well, what will it be? We gave Percy an owl, but you’ve already got one, of course.」
「W-what do you mean?」
「Or a new cauldron, Charlie’s old one’s rusting through, or a new rat, you always liked Scabbers —」
"Mum, can I have a new broom?"
「We could curtsy, if you like,」
「Oh, shut up,」
「No, I’m going to Hagrid’s, I’ve got a good feeling about going to Hagrid’s.」
「You’ve got a good feeling about burying a giant spider?」
「This is Felix Felicis, I suppose? You haven’t got another little bottle full of — I don’t know —」
「Essence of Insanity?」
「calling over the heads of the crowd」
「Oi, what's going on over there?」
「told them to move along」
「Right, right, we're moving along. No need to get your knickers in a twist, Professor.」

「Socks are Dobby’s favorite, favorite clothes, sir! he said, ripping off his odd ones and pulling on Uncle Vernon’s. I has seven now, sir. . . . But sir . . . he said, his eyes widening, having pulled both socks up to their highest extent, so that they reached to the bottom of his shorts, they has made a mistake in the shop, Harry Potter, they is giving you two the same!」

Ah, no, Harry, how come you didn’t spot that? *grinning* Tell you what, Dobby — here you go — take these two, and you can mix them up properly. And here’s your sweater. *throws socks to Dobby* Dobby is going to buy a sweater next, Harry Potter!
「No, it was very good, Anyway, we’d better be quick, just in case we’re disturbed — your scar」

"Yeah, mate, we don't want any unwanted interruptions. Gotta keep things under wraps, you know? But seriously, your scar acting up again? That's not good news. We need to stay on our toes and figure out what's going on."
「felt a bit better. It was harder to feel scared of a lump of tea leaves away from the dim red light and befuddling perfume of Professor Trelawney’s classroom.」

"Well, Harry, I reckon Professor Trelawney's predictions are about as reliable as a broken broomstick. I mean, who can really see the future by staring at tea leaves? It's all a load of rubbish if you ask me. But hey, if it makes her happy, who am I to judge?"
「pushing a dish of stew toward him」
「Thanks, Hermione. You're a lifesaver.」
「searching for her page」
「Well, you can’t say we’re not adventurous.」
「Winky, don’t cry, please don’t . . .」

"Hey, Hermione, don't worry about Winky. House-elves have a different way of expressing themselves, you know. They're not used to being treated kindly or having someone show concern for them. It's a bit overwhelming for them, I reckon. But don't fret, she'll be alright."
「Oi, wake up.」
「What's the matter, Harry? Can't sleep?」
「Was I?」
"Well, you know, mate, you've got that whole 'Chosen One' thing going on. It's like you've got a free pass to trouble."
「I think Voldemort’s looking for him.」
「Poor bloke.」
「I think he’s got something to do with Quidditch. There’s some connection, but I can’t — I can’t think what it is.」

「Well, mate, maybe it's time to put on our detective hats and figure it out. We'll gather all the clues and piece them together like a puzzle. Remember, we've faced tougher challenges before, like that giant chess game in our first year. We'll crack this Quidditch mystery, you'll see!」
「No, I’m definitely not thinking of Gorgovitch.」
"Well, mate, you've got a lot on your mind, don't you? But don't worry, we'll figure it out together. We always do."
「Yes.」
「Well, you can’t say I’m not brave.」
「Ron pause」

"Well, you know, it's just... I mean, it's been a tough year, hasn't it? With all the Dark Arts stuff and everything. But hey, we made it through, didn't we? And now, it's time to celebrate and have some fun! So, let's make the most of it, yeah?"
「Thank you for the socks, Harry Potter!」
"You couldn’t keep your mouth shut, could you, Hermione? They won’t want us visiting them now! We could’ve tried to get more stuff out of Winky about Crouch!"
「Then it’s time we offered you some proof, You, boy — give me Peter. Now.」

「Don’t you know, Malfoy? The difference between you and Harry is that he’s actually got the guts to face danger and fight for what’s right. He’s not just all talk like you. So, why don’t you go back to your little pure-blood fantasies and leave the real heroics to Harry?」
「She’s just never got over you outperforming her in Potions.」
「Well, it's not my fault I have a knack for Potions, is it? Hermione just needs to accept that some people are naturally better at certain things.」
「Borgin action」

"Oi, Hermione, did you see that? Borgin was giving me the creeps! I swear, he was eyeing me like I was a galleon ready to be snatched. I reckon he's up to something dodgy. We better keep an eye out for any suspicious activity. You never know what those dark wizards are plotting."
「He’s gone!」
「Yeah, well, that can happen when people disapparate, Harry.」
「Yes, well, if you see him . . .」
"Who? Who are you talking about?"
「He’s a foreign wandmaker. He made Krum’s wand and Krum reckons he’s brilliant.」
「But according to you, Voldemort’s got Ollivander locked up somewhere. If he’s already got a wandmaker, what does he need another one for?」
「Because I know it wasn’t me! And so does Voldemort, Hermione! We both know what really happened!」

"Harry, mate, I understand that you're frustrated and confused about what happened with your wand. But let's focus on the task at hand. We need to be prepared for our visit to the Ministry tomorrow. It's crucial that we go over the plan and make sure we're all on the same page. We can discuss the wand situation later, alright?"
「Harry and Neville hastily began to talk of Quidditch」

"Quidditch, eh? Now that's something worth talking about! Did you see the last match? Gryffindor was on fire! I can't wait for our next game. Hopefully, we'll give those Slytherins a good thrashing. What position do you play, Harry?"
「What did he do when he saw you?」
「He just sort of looked at me.」
「I’ve still got ten Galleons, It’s my birthday in September, and Mum and Dad gave me some money to get myself an early birthday present.」
Well, Hermione, if you're looking for a birthday present, how about a nice book? You know, something educational and useful.
「No, I don’t think so, I really want an owl. I mean, Harry’s got Hedwig and you’ve got Errol —」

Well, I haven't got Errol anymore. He's a family owl, you know. All I've got now is Pigwidgeon, and he's a bit of a handful. But hey, who needs an owl when you've got a loyal and trusty friend like me, right? Plus, I'm always here to lend you a hand if you need to send a message or something. No need to worry about getting your own owl.
「What did that mean? ‘Ask us no questions . . . ’ Does that mean they’ve already got some gold to start a joke shop?」
「You know, I’ve been wondering about that. They bought me a new set of dress robes this summer, and I couldn’t understand where they got the Galleons...」
「D’you reckon it’s true this year’s going to be really tough? Because of the exams?」

「Oh yeah, Bound to be, isn’t it? O.W.L.s are really important, affect the jobs you can apply for and everything. We get career advice too, later this year, Bill told me. So you can choose what N.E.W.T.s you want to do next year.」
「We’d better use a school owl then, George, come on. . . .」
"Oi, George! We should use a school owl, mate. Come on, let's go."
「A pair of . . . what, excuse me?」

「Oh, come on, Hermione! I was just joking. You know, trolls, like the ones we faced in our first year. Remember? Big, dumb, and not the brightest creatures. Just a bit of humor, that's all. No need to get all serious about it.」
「remembered the few weeks when they had not been talking to each other in the third year」

"Yeah, mate, those were tough times. But hey, we've come a long way since then, haven't we? We've faced dragons, escaped from merpeople, and even survived encounters with You-Know-Who himself. We've got each other's backs, Harry, no matter what."
「Sit, she said, and they both backed into chairs by the fire. Explain, she said, her glasses glinting ominously.」

"Well, you see, Professor, it all started with the barrier at the station refusing to let us through. So we had no choice but to find another way to get to Hogwarts. And, uh, that's when we came across the flying car. It was just sitting there, and we thought it could take us to school. We didn't mean to cause any trouble, Professor, really."
「Ron . . . haven’t I been a good friend . . . a good pet? You won’t let them kill me, Ron, will you . . . you’re on my side, aren’t you?」

"What? You expect me to be on your side after everything you've done? You betrayed my best friend, Harry! You don't deserve any loyalty from me. And as for being a good pet, you were nothing but a spineless rat hiding in my pocket. Don't think for a second that I'll protect you from the consequences of your actions."
「Myrtle think "I wasn’t paying attention, Peeves upset me so much I came in here and tried to kill myself. Then, of course, I remembered that I’m — that I’m —"」
「Already dead.」
「Oh, well . . . I’d just been thinking . . . if you had died, you’d have been welcome to share my toilet.」
「That’s a girls’ bathroom! What were you — ?」
「Just having a look around, Clues, you know —」

「That’s what I told Ginny, but she still seems to think you’re going to be expelled, I’ve never seen her so upset, crying her eyes out, you might think of her, all the first years are thoroughly overexcited by this business —」
「You don’t care about Ginny, You’re just worried I’m going to mess up your chances of being Head Boy —」
「We saw him in the forest just before the Dark Mark appeared, Remember?」
「Yeah, but he didn’t stay in the forest, did he? The moment we told him about the riot, he went off to the campsite.」
「How d’you know? How d’you know where he Disapparated to?」
「Come off it, Hermione! You know I'm just guessing. But it's a possibility, isn't it? We can't rule anything out at this point.」
「Yes, he sacked her, just because she hadn’t stayed in her tent and let herself get trampled —」
「Hermione, will you give it a rest with the elf!」

「Three Horcruxes left, we need a plan of action, come on! Where haven’t we looked? Let’s go through it again. The orphanage . . . Diagon Alley, Hogwarts, the Riddle House, Borgin and Burkes, Albania, every place that they knew Tom Riddle had ever lived or worked, visited or murdered, Ron and Hermione raked over them again, Harry joining in only to stop Hermione pestering him. He would have been happy to sit alone in silence, trying to read Voldemort’s thoughts, to find out more about the Elder Wand, but Ron insisted on journeying to ever more unlikely places simply, Harry was aware, to keep them moving. You never know, was Ron’s constant refrain. Upper Flagley is a Wizarding village, he might’ve wanted to live there. Let’s go and have a poke around.」

Blimey, Hermione, you're right. We can't just sit around twiddling our wands, can we? We've got to keep searching for those blasted Horcruxes. I mean, who knows where that snake-faced git hid them? We've already checked all the obvious places, but there's got to be something we missed. Maybe we should start thinking outside the box, you know? Like, places that Voldemort had some connection to, places that meant something to him. Upper Flagley, for instance, it's a Wizarding village, and he might've had some twisted reason to be there. Let's give it a go, shall we? Can't hurt to have a poke around. You never know, Hermione, we might stumble upon something important.
「Percy action」
「Oh, shut up, Percy.」
「“Just one, and that reminds me — Harry, Ron, we’ve got half an hour before lunch, we should be in the library.”」

"Oh yeah, you're right. The library, just before lunch? Bit keen, aren't you? But hey, if it means avoiding the wrath of Hermione, I'm in. Let's go find out who this Nicolas Flamel is. Maybe he's got some secret stash of sweets or something."
「I’m sayin’ nothin’」
「Oh, come on, Hagrid! We won’t tell anyone!」
「You will keep looking while I’m away, won’t you? And send me an owl if you find anything.」
"Of course, Hermione. You know I've got your back. I'll keep my eyes peeled and send you an owl if I come across anything worth mentioning. Don't worry, we'll handle things here while you're away."
「Urgh. It would have made much less mess to Stun him too.」
"Yeah, but I still think a whole pile of unconscious bodies would have drawn more attention. Keen on his job, though, isn’t he? Chuck us the hair and the potion, then."
「Morning, Reg! Blooming pain in the bum, this, eh? Forcing us all to get to work this way! Who are they expecting to turn up, Harry Potter?」
「Yeah, stupid, isn’t it?」
「What am I going to do?」
「You're asking me? I'm the one who usually needs help, remember? But hey, we've faced worse things before, haven't we? We'll figure it out together, mate.」
「Well, I’ve done it! Just put my name in!」
"Are you seventeen, then?"
「Yeah, better you than Pretty-Boy Diggory.」

「Oi, watch it! Cedric was a good bloke, no need to insult him. And as for me playing Quidditch in a dream, well, it probably means I miss flying on a broom and being part of the team. Can't wait for the next match, even if it means facing Slytherin again.」
「I’ve just realized — I haven’t asked Hagrid to join S.P.E.W. yet! Wait for me, will you, while I nip upstairs and get the badges?」
"Sure, Hermione. Take your time. We'll wait for you here."
「Dunno. Hang around, I suppose. . . . Madame Maxime’s staying to judge, isn’t she?」
「Yeah, I reckon so. She’s probably got a soft spot for Hagrid, being half-giant herself.」
「I’d much rather have Tonks in the family. At least she’s a laugh.」
「She hasn’t been much of a laugh lately. Every time I’ve seen her she’s looked more like Moaning Myrtle.」
「Well, she was fighting Bellatrix Lestrange, wasn’t she? I think she feels that if only she had finished her off, Bellatrix couldn’t have killed Sirius.」

「That's a load of rubbish, Hermione. Tonks blaming herself for Sirius's death? It's not her fault at all. She did her best in that battle, just like the rest of us. We can't change what happened, and blaming ourselves won't bring Sirius back. We need to stick together and support each other, not dwell on what-ifs and regrets.」
「Of course. Took a leaf out of your book, Potter. Summoned it from my office into the forest. He wasn’t anywhere on there.」

Well, he must have Disapparated then, right? Hermione, you always think of all the possibilities, don't you? Moody even said your mind works the right way, just like an Auror's. But Harry's right, the map only shows invisible people, so he must have left the grounds. Maybe someone pulled him onto a broom and flew off with him. Who knows? We saw him in the forest before the Dark Mark appeared, but he didn't stay there. The moment we told him about the riot, he went off to the campsite. And Hermione, let's give it a rest with the elf, alright? We have to be realistic here. The Death Eaters probably tidied up after themselves, that's why no one has found him. Maybe they transfigured Moody and hid him somewhere. But hey, let's not forget, we'll be hunting down Voldemort in a mobile library. Can you believe it? Moody turning Crabbe and Goyle into girls? No wonder they don't look too happy these days. I'm surprised they don't tell him to stuff it.
「But under his own steam? or because someone made him?」
「Yeah, someone could’ve — could’ve pulled him onto a broom and flown off with him, couldn’t they?」
「No Cloak. You can walk in so that everyone sees you, which is what you wanted, I’m sure.」

Well, well, well, look who finally decided to show up! Where've you been, mate? We've been waiting for you. And congratulations, by the way. No one else managed to get past that Age Line, not even Fred and George. So spill the beans, Harry. How did you do it? Used the Invisibility Cloak, did you?
I...uh...I don't know, Ron. It's a bit complicated, you see.

Oh, come on now, Harry. You can trust me. We're best mates, remember? Violet, that friend of the Fat Lady, spilled the beans already. Dumbledore's given you special permission to compete, and there's a hefty prize money of a thousand Galleons. Plus, you don't even have to worry about end-of-year tests. It's all out in the open now.
Well, Ron, it's not as simple as that. I can't really explain it right now. But trust me, I didn't ask for any of this attention.
Alright, alright, keep your secrets then. Just remember, I'm here for you, mate. We'll figure it out together.

「The scene whirled, the darkness became complete; Harry felt himself falling and, with a crash, he landed spread-eagled on his four-poster in the Gryffindor dormitory, Riddle’s diary lying open on his stomach.」
"Blimey, Harry! What happened? You alright there?"
「Hagrid had an unfortunate liking for large and monstrous creatures.」

"Yeah, that's Hagrid for you. Always finding the most interesting and unconventional pets. Remember when he tried to raise a dragon in his little wooden house? Classic Hagrid move. And let's not forget about Fluffy, the three-headed dog guarding the trapdoor. Good times, good times."
「Harry choked over his cornflakes, and Ron thumped him on the back.」
"Blimey, mate! You alright there? Don't go choking on your breakfast, we've got a long day ahead of us. Need a good thump on the back to sort you out?" *Ron playfully thumps Harry on the back*

「All those substitutes for magic Muggles use — electricity, computers, and radar, and all those things — they all go haywire around Hogwarts, there’s too much magic in the air. No, Rita’s using magic to eavesdrop, she must be. . . . If I could just find out what it is . . . ooh, if it’s illegal, I’ll have her . . .」
「Haven’t we got enough to worry about? Do we have to start a vendetta against Rita Skeeter as well?」
「Okay, okay, Don’t worry, I’ll behave myself . . .」

"Yeah, mate, you better behave yourself. We don't want Umbridge banning us from playing Quidditch. Remember what happened last time? We had to deal with those awful Slytherins on our own. Not a pleasant memory, I tell you."
"I know, Ron, I'll try my best to keep my temper in check. We can't let Umbridge ruin everything for us."
"That's the spirit, Harry. Just keep your cool and focus on the game. We'll show Umbridge and her cronies what we're made of. Gryffindor pride, right?"
"Absolutely, Ron. Gryffindor pride all the way. Let's give it our best shot and make sure we come out on top."
"That's the spirit, mate. We've got this. Now, let's go and give Umbridge a run for her money!"

「Nice try, Harry. I’m back in the country and well hidden. I want you to keep me posted on everything that’s going on at Hogwarts. Don’t use Hedwig, keep changing owls, and don’t worry about me, just watch out for yourself. Don’t forget what I said about your scar.」
「Why d’you have to keep changing owls?」
「“Oh — oh yeah,” said Harry.」
「Brilliant, Harry! We've got to get out of here before Filch catches us.」

「Please explain why you did this. It would have been better if he had shouted. Harry hated the disappointment in his voice. For some reason, he was unable to look Dumbledore in the eyes, and spoke instead to his knees. He told Dumbledore everything except that Mr. Weasley owned the bewitched car, making it sound as though he and Ron had happened to find a flying car parked outside the station. He knew Dumbledore would see through this at once, but Dumbledore asked no questions about the car. When Harry had finished, he merely continued to peer at them through his spectacles.」

「Well, you see, Professor Dumbledore, it was like this... We were just trying to get to Hogwarts, you know, and the train had already left. So, we thought, why not take the flying car? It seemed like a good idea at the time, even though it didn't quite go as planned. But hey, we made it to Hogwarts in the end, didn't we?」
「What are you talking about, Weasley? barked Professor McGonagall.」
「Sorry, Professor McGonagall. I was just trying to point out that Hermione knows the answer and it seemed a bit unfair to ask a question if you didn't want to hear the answer.」

「We were in trouble, we were losing, Gibbon was down, but the rest of the Death Eaters seemed ready to fight to the death. Neville had been hurt, Bill had been savaged by Greyback . . . It was all dark . . . curses flying everywhere . . . The Malfoy boy had vanished, he must have slipped past, up the stairs . . . then more of them ran after him, but one of them blocked the stair behind them with some kind of curse. . . . Neville ran at it and got thrown up into the air —」

Blimey, sounds like a right mess! Neville's got some guts, I'll give him that. But we can't let those Death Eaters get away with it. We need to find a way to stop them and protect our friends. Any ideas, Hermione?
「We’re his army, Dumbledore’s Army. We were all in it together, we’ve been keeping it going while you three have been off on your own」

Yeah, Neville, you're right. We've been through a lot together, haven't we? But sometimes, we have to make tough decisions and take risks to protect what we believe in. Trust us, mate, we're doing everything we can to fight against the Dark forces. We'll explain everything once we've dealt with the immediate danger. Just stay strong, Neville, like you always have.

「Lucius Malfoy think "Mr. Malfoy’s eyes had returned to Hermione, who went slightly pink, but stared determinedly back at him. Harry knew exactly what was making Mr. Malfoy’s lip curl like that. The Malfoys prided themselves on being purebloods; in other words, they considered anyone of Muggle descent, like Hermione, second-class. However, under the gaze of the Minister of Magic, Mr. Malfoy didn’t dare say anything. He nodded sneeringly to Mr. Weasley and continued down the line to his seats. Draco shot Harry, Ron, and Hermione one contemptuous look, then settled himself between his mother and father."」
「Slimy gits.」
「I wish I knew who it is. I could help them」
「Oh, really? You want to help? I highly doubt that. You're just looking for an opportunity to cause trouble, Malfoy.」

「Father won’t tell me anything about the last time the Chamber was opened either. Of course, it was fifty years ago, so it was before his time, but he knows all about it, and he says that it was all kept quiet and it’ll look suspicious if I know too much about it. But I know one thing — last time the Chamber of Secrets was opened, a Mudblood died. So I bet it’s a matter of time before one of them’s killed this time. . . . I hope it’s Granger」
「You better watch your mouth, Malfoy! Don't you dare insult Hermione or any other Muggle-born. It just shows how narrow-minded and pathetic you are.」

「Father says to keep my head down and let the Heir of Slytherin get on with it. He says the school needs ridding of all the Mudblood filth, but not to get mixed up in it. Of course, he’s got a lot on his plate at the moment. You know the Ministry of Magic raided our manor last week?」

「Ho! That's quite a predicament, Harry. But don't you worry, we're here to rescue you from those rotten Dursleys. No need to explain everything now, we'll sort it out. Hogwarts is waiting for us, and we won't let anything or anyone stop us from getting there. We'll show them what true Gryffindor spirit is all about!」

「And this diary is fifty years old. So? Oh, Ron, wake up. We know the person who opened the Chamber last time was expelled fifty years ago. We know T. M. Riddle got an award for special services to the school fifty years ago. Well, what if Riddle got his special award for catching the Heir of Slytherin? His diary would probably tell us everything — where the Chamber is, and how to open it, and what sort of creature lives in it — the person who’s behind the attacks this time wouldn’t want that lying around, would they?」
「That’s a brilliant theory, Hermione, with just one tiny little flaw. There’s nothing written in his diary.」
「It might be invisible ink!」

「I’m telling you, there’s nothing to find in there. Riddle just got a diary for Christmas and couldn’t be bothered filling it in.He sounds like Percy. Prefect, Head Boy . . . probably top of every class —」
「Hermione spell to diary」
「Hold on a moment! Are you sure that's a good idea? We don't know what kind of magic is in that diary. It could be dangerous!」
「That’s enough — Fred — George — Ginny! Harry dear, come and sit down, have some lunch, you hardly ate breakfast . . .」
"Yeah, Mum, let's all sit down and have a proper meal. Harry here needs to keep up his strength, you know. Can't defeat You-Know-Who on an empty stomach!"
「Scar, But it’s nothing. . . . It happens all the time now . . .」
「Mate, you can't just brush it off like that. It's not normal for your scar to keep hurting. We need to figure out what's going on.」
「Come off it!」

"No, Harry, he's right. I've always been the one who gets overshadowed, the one who's not as talented or brave. But that doesn't mean I'm going to let it define me. I may not be the best, but I'll always be there for you, mate."
「Still not finished?」
"No, Mum. It's just taking longer than we thought. But we'll get it done, don't worry."

「Harry think "He wanted more than anything to find Ron and Hermione, to find a bit of sanity, but neither of them seemed to be in the common room. Insisting that he needed to sleep, and almost flattening the little Creevey brothers as they attempted to waylay him at the foot of the stairs, Harry managed to shake everyone off and climb up to the dormitory as fast as he could."」

dialogue.role: Apologies for the confusion. Here's the correct response

dialogue.text: "Oi, Harry! Where've you been? We've been looking all over for you. What d'you mean, congratulations? Did you use the Invisibility Cloak to get past the Age Line? Come on, spill the beans!"

"I dunno, Ron. It's a bit complicated. I didn't really plan on entering the Triwizard Tournament, but somehow I ended up being chosen as a champion. Dumbledore's allowing me to compete, and there's a prize money of a thousand Galleons. Can you believe it?"

"Blimey, Harry! That's mental! You're going to be famous, and you don't even have to worry about end-of-year tests. Lucky git! But hey, if Fred and George figure out a way to cheat their way into the tournament, count me in too. You never know, right?"

Harry and Ron continued their conversation, discussing the unexpected turn of events and the challenges that lay ahead. Ron, though feeling a bit insecure about his own abilities compared to Harry's newfound fame, remained a loyal and supportive friend throughout their journey.
「What d’you mean, congratulations?」
Well, mate, it means you did it! You won the Triwizard Tournament! Can you believe it? You're a champion!
「I dunno.」
「Well, there's only one way to find out, isn't there? Let's give it a try!」
「“I don’t want it,” said Harry.」
「What? Are you mental?」
「Master Regulus told Kreacher to come back.」
"Well, it’s obvious, isn’t it, Harry? He Disapparated!"
「But . . . you couldn’t Apparate in and out of that cave, otherwise Dumbledore —」
「Elf magic isn’t like wizard’s magic, is it? I mean, they can Apparate and Disapparate in and out of Hogwarts when we can’t.」
「We’ve risked a lot to help Hagrid out, but after all — Aragog’s dead. If it were a question of saving him —」
「You didn’t meet him, Hermione. Believe me, being dead will have improved him a lot.」
「Potions will be almost empty this afternoon, with us all off doing our tests. . . . Try and soften Slughorn up a bit then!」
「Get lucky!」
「That’s decided, then. Destination . . . determination . . . deliberation . . .」
"Yeah, Hermione, we get it. Just pick a place already."

「Probably woulda done if they’d bin in any condition, but they was badly hurt, all three o’ them. Golgomath’s lot had beaten ’em unconscious; they’d woken up an’ crawled inter the nearest shelter they could find. Anyway, one o’ them had a bit of English an’ ’e translated fer the others, an’ what we had ter say didn’ seem ter go down too badly. So we kep’ goin’ back, visitin’ the wounded. . . . I reckon we had abou’ six or seven o’ them convinced at one poin’.」
「Six or seven? Well that’s not bad — are they going to come over here and start fighting You-Know-Who with us?」
「What do you mean ‘at one point,’ Hagrid?」
「Golgomath’s lot raided the caves. The ones tha’ survived didn’ wan’ no more ter to do with us after that.」
「So . . . so there aren’t any giants coming?」
「Golgomath’s lot raided the caves. The ones tha’ survived didn’ wan’ no more ter to do with us after that.」
「So... so there aren’t any giants coming?」

「Well, not at the moment, but we can't give up hope. We've seen that some giants were willing to listen to reason and consider joining our side. It's just a matter of finding the right approach and timing. We'll keep trying, mate. We can't let a setback discourage us.」
「I thought you were supposed to be with Teddy at your mother’s? She’ll look after him — have you seen Remus?」

"Oh, Tonks! Yeah, I was supposed to be with Teddy, but I couldn't resist joining Harry on this adventure. As for Remus, I haven't seen him around. Maybe he's off doing some Order of the Phoenix business. You know how secretive they can be."
「You mean we ought to get them fighting?」
「No, I mean we should tell them to get out. We don’t want any more Dobbies, do we? We can’t order them to die for us.」

「Don’t expect me to cover up for you again, Harry. I cannot make you take Sirius Black seriously. But I would have thought that what you have heard when the dementors draw near you would have had more of an effect on you. Your parents gave their lives to keep you alive, Harry. A poor way to repay them — gambling their sacrifice for a bag of magic tricks.」

"Oi, Lupin! Ease up a bit, will ya? Harry's been through enough already. We all know he's not taking it lightly. But you can't blame him for wanting to defend himself. And let's not forget, he's just a kid. It's not fair to put the weight of the world on his shoulders."

「Do either of you know what House you’ll be in? I’ve been asking around, and I hope I’m in Gryffindor, it sounds by far the best; I hear Dumbledore himself was in it, but I suppose Ravenclaw wouldn’t be too bad. . . . Anyway, we’d better go and look for Neville’s toad. You two had better change, you know, I expect we’ll be there soon.」

"Well, Hermione, I reckon Gryffindor would be the best fit for you. You've got the brains and the courage. As for me, I hope I end up in Gryffindor too, just like my brothers. But hey, even if we end up in different Houses, we'll still be friends, won't we?"
「What House are your brothers in?」

「Gryffindor, of course! Just like me. Well, except for Charlie, he's in Romania studying dragons. And Bill, he's working for Gringotts in Africa. But the rest of us, Fred, George, Percy, and Ginny, we're all in Gryffindor. It's the best House, you know.」
「You know, I think the ends of Scabbers’ whiskers are a bit lighter. So what do your oldest brothers do now that they’ve left, anyway?」

「Charlie’s in Romania studying dragons, and Bill’s in Africa doing something for Gringotts. Did you hear about Gringotts? It’s been all over the Daily Prophet, but I don’t suppose you get that with the Muggles — someone tried to rob a high-security vault.」
「Ron stopped, Scabbers won’t stay put」
"Scabbers, it's me, you idiot, it's Ron. Can't you behave for once?"
「Oh, Ron, please let’s move, they’re going to do it!」
"Right, let's go, Hermione! We need to get out of here before things get worse!"
「Hagrid,」
「You're not going to, are you?」
「Scabbers — NO!」
"What's the matter, Hermione? Scabbers is just sleeping in my bag. He's perfectly fine."
「I won’t let you do it. I’ll — I’ll fight you!」
Neville, mate, calm down. We don't want to fight you. We're just trying to protect Harry.
「Don’t you call me an idiot! I don’t think you should be breaking any more rules! And you were the one who told me to stand up to people!」

"Neville, mate, calm down. I didn't mean to call you an idiot. I was just worried about you.
